benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/admin/healthcheck - Put the host out of rotation

covered: Valid Deletion: Successful removal of host from rotation (HTTP 204) with an empty response body.
Authorization: Tests cover missing authentication (401) and invalid authentication (401).
Error Handling and Validation: Covers service unavailability (503), internal server error (500), invalid payload (400), and invalid/malicious headers (400/401).
State Handling: Tests both host already out of rotation (409) and system with no hosts in rotation (409).
Performance: Normal load response time (TC10) and concurrency (TC11).
Regression: Post-operation verification that host status is out of rotation (TC12).
gaps: Soft Deletes: No explicit test distinguishing soft-delete semantics from a simple “out of rotation” flag; only state is tested.
recommendations: Add explicit soft-delete semantics testing to confirm whether the host is only flagged or also removed from persistence.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests to validate behavior under burst traffic.
Add caching behavior tests (e.g., ETag, Cache-Control headers) to verify caching semantics.
Add an explicit 404 Not Found test for non-existent resource semantics (in addition to the existing 409 for no hosts).
Add a more explicit race-condition/concurrency test scenario to simulate true simultaneous deletions.
